**Tournament Details**: The inaugural MLC tournament has kicked off in the US, featuring six teams owned by top global sporting bodies.

**Team Owners**: The teams are owned by prominent groups, including Shah Rukh Khan's Knight Riders Group (Los Angeles Knight Riders), Mukesh Ambani's Mumbai Indians (MI New York), GMR Group (Seattle Orcas), Chennai Super Kings IPL franchise (Texas Super Kings), Cricket Victoria (San Francisco Unicorns), and Cricket New South Wales (Washington Freedom).

**Venues**: The games will be played at the Grand Prairie stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina.

**Broadcasting**: The tournament will be broadcast live across major cricketing nations, including the US, Australia, Caribbean, New Zealand, Pakistan, South Africa, UK, and India.

**Players**: The tournament has attracted top cricketers from around the world, including Rashid Khan, Shadab Khan, Faf du Plessis, David Miller, Sunil Narine, Kieron Pollard, Andre Russell, Marcus Stoinis, Aaron Finch, Jason Roy, and Trent Boult.

**First Game Result**: The first game of the season was won by the Texas Super Kings, who beat the Los Angeles Knight Riders.

The MLC's financial backing has made it a threat to English cricket, as it can offer higher wages to top players. The league is expected to expand next year, with more matches that may clash with the English season. **Broadcasting Partnership**

* Willow by Cricbuzz and Monumental Sports Network (MNMT) have announced a partnership to broadcast Washington Freedom matches this upcoming MLC season.
* The partnership will bring live, streaming, and on-demand cricket coverage to fans in the network's footprint.

**Broadcast Schedule**

* The first match available to fans on Monumental Sports Network will be the Freedom's season opener vs MI New York on July 6, 2024, at 3:00 PM ET.
* The network will feature seven matches from July 6 to July 22, including matches against Texas Super Kings, Seattle Orcas, LA Knight Riders, and San Francisco Unicorns.

**Availability**

* Fans within the network's footprint can watch Washington Freedom matches live on Monumental Sports Network, which is available on linear TV and streaming platforms.
* Viewers can access these matches through their Pay TV subscription, directly on monumentalsportsnetwork.com, or by using the Monumental Sports Network streaming app, compatible with various devices.
* Direct-to-consumer subscription memberships are also available for those without a Pay TV subscription.
